SECRET
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 1st NOVEMBER, 1918.
WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
In FLANDERS the operation undertaken yesterday was entirely successful and the line now runs as follows :- KERKHOVE, CASTER, western outskirts of GYSELBRECHTEGHEM, east of ANSEGHEM, STEENBRUGGE, west of NOKERE, HET BUNDER, PETEGHEM.
Over 1,500 prisoners are reported captured. An American Division took part in this attack.
This morning the First and Third Armies made a minor attack between VALENCIENNES and SEPMERIES which is reported to be making satisfactory progress. MARESCHES AND AULMOY have been taken and the southern outskirts of VALENCIENNES have been taken and the southern outskirts of VALENCIENNES have been reached. Some prisoners have been taken.
French Front.
There is no change in the situation.
ITALIAN FRONT.
Between the BRENTA and the PIAVE the Italians have captured COL CAPRILE, COL BONATO, MONTE ASOLONE, MONTE PRASSOLAN, the summit of SOLAROLO and MONTE SPINONCIA and are still advancing north of Quero.
The advance across the PIAVE has extended to the whole front as far as the sea. The Eight Army has occupied the ridges north of the SOLIGO valley and the pass of FOSSALTO. The Tenth Army is on the LIVENZA.
The number of prisoners captured is more than 50,000 and over 300 guns have been taken.
BALKAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
1st November, 1918.
Issued at 1250.
